title: Stefan Stojkovic
text:
Hi, I’m Stefan. Welcome to my website where you can find my CV, personal projects, and more details about my work and myself.

Summary
I am a Data Analyst (R | SQL | Python) with 4 years of experience in research design, as well as causal and descriptive statistics. Proficient in data analysis, research design, statistical modeling, and data visualization. I currently work (until September 30, 2025) on an international European Research Council-funded project at Witten/Herdecke University. The project is focused on political risk assessment in Europe. My job is to collect, tidy, model and transform complex data into actionable insights. I have a proven track record of enhancing project efficiency and supporting decision-making processes through data-driven consulting.
You can contact me at: stojkovicstefan7@gmail.com

title: Projects
text:
Projects


Freedom vs Security
A brief exploration of the balance between freedom and security.
Read more

title: Freedom vs Security
text:
In this project, I explore the delicate balance between freedom and security.
By using the World Value Survey (WVS) Wave 7, I show the difference across countries in the degree to which people prefer one of these two fundamental values. I single out the countries who score particularly high on each dimension, as well as calculate and display the EU average to understand it relative to the other cases.
I used R to extract key insights from the data. For more details, you can check out the complete R code and dataset on my GitHub repository.




The results show that nearly 75% of people in the United States favor freedom as opposed to security. The is by far the highest figure in the dataset. By contrast, countries like China and Indonesia are on the other end Roughly 90% of citizens in these two countries report that security plays a more important role in their lives than freedom. The European Union comes in between with 60% of its citizens preferring security and some 40% freedom.

title: Freedom vs Security
text:
Here, you can expand on the methodology, results, and conclusions.
For example, you might describe the steps taken in your R script, discuss the significance of the findings, and explain the context behind the data.
Dataset: WV7_freedom_vs_security.csv
Code: freedom_vs_security.R
